intro: Fadogia stenophylla subsp. odorata, commonly known as the fragrant stenophylla, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The subspecies is distinguished by its aromatic foliage, which emits a pleasant scent, particularly when crushed. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique fragrance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
